author: William Mauldin
title: Trump Mulls Tariffs, Quotas on Foreign Steel
text:
WASHINGTON—President Donald Trump told lawmakers Tuesday that he is eyeing “tariffs and/or quotas” as a way of restricting U.S. imports of steel and aluminum on national-security grounds, but he acknowledged concerns that blocking metal imports could lead to price increases for U.S. industries that use the metals.
“We cannot be without a steel industry, we can’t be without an aluminum industry, and so what we’re talking about is tariffs and/or quotas,” Mr. Trump said at a meeting with Senate and House lawmakers.
... RELATED VIDEO What the Big Trade Deficit Number Really Means The U.S. trade deficit hit its widest mark since 2008 last year, totaling $566 billion in President Trump's first year in office. WSJ's Gerald F. Seib explains why the number may not be quite as bad as it appears on its face. Photo: AP
